meanings.definition: The quality or state of being tridimensional.
meanings.sent1: The tridimensionalities of the cube make it look solid and real.
meanings.sent2: Artists often explore tridimensionalities in their sculptures.
meanings.sent3: The tridimensionalities of the virtual reality world amazed the players.
meanings.sent4: Her understanding of tridimensionalities in space was as clear as crystal.
meanings.sent5: The professor explained the tridimensionalities of the object with great detail.

meanings.sent1: Scientists study the tridimensionalities of space to understand our universe.
meanings.sent2: Children learn about tridimensionalities in school when they study shapes.
meanings.sent3: The tridimensionalities of the new building design impressed the architects.
meanings.sent4: The tridimensionalities of time and space are complex concepts in physics.
meanings.sent5: The artist's painting captured the tridimensionalities of the landscape beautifully.

meanings.definition: The property of having three dimensions.
meanings.sent1: The tridimensionalities of the object were evident from every angle.
meanings.sent2: Virtual reality technology aims to replicate tridimensionalities in a digital space.
meanings.sent3: The tridimensionalities of the puzzle made it challenging to solve.
meanings.sent4: The tridimensionalities of the room created a sense of depth and space.
meanings.sent5: Understanding the tridimensionalities of an object helps in accurate representation.
